issue.title: [Doc] C data interface example for i32 uses `l`, not `i`, in the format
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-10189](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-10189). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
The [specification](https://arrow.apache.org/docs/format/CDataInterface.html#data-type-description-format-strings) uses "i" to represent i32, but the [example](https://arrow.apache.org/docs/format/CDataInterface.html#exporting-a-simple-int32-array) uses "l" (i64).

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-10189?focusedCommentId=17208539) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Issue resolved by pull request 8357
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/8357>
